trans-unit.source:
\n

Specifies the minimum length of array or string data allowed in a property.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the array or string data.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the minimum allowable length of the array or string data.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The minimum allowable length of the array or string data.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Applies formatting to a specified error message.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name to include in the formatted string.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A localized string to describe the minimum acceptable length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Determines whether a specified object is valid.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the specified object is valid; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x
